block.p: American League BALTIMORE ORIOLES--Activated OF B.J. Surhoff from the 15-day disabled list. Optioned RHP Travis Driskill to Ottawa of the IL. CHICAGO WHITE SOX--Purchased the contract of LHP Neal Cotts from Birmingham of the Southern League. KANSAS CITY ROYALS--Designated 2B Carlos Febles for assignment. Activated INF Mendy Lopez from the 15-day disabled list. SEATTLE MARINERS--Activated RHP Kazuhiro Sasaki from the 15-day disabled list. Optioned RHP J.J. Putz to Tacoma of the PCL. TEXAS RANGERS--Purchased the contract of RHP Juan Dominguez from Oklahoma of the PCL. Optioned RHP Rosman Garcia to Oklahoma. Transferred RHP Ricardo Rodriguez from the 15- to the 60-day disabled list.

National League ATLANTA BRAVES--Acquired LHP Kent Mercker from Cincinnati for a player to be named. Designated OF Cory Aldridge for assignment. CINCINNATI REDS--Called up LHP Mark Watson and C Corky Miller from Louisville of the IL. Optioned RHP Joe Valentine to Louisville.

National League ATLANTA BRAVES--Acquired LHP Kent Mercker from Cincinnati for a player to be named. Designated OF Cory Aldridge for assignment. CINCINNATI REDS--Called up LHP Mark Watson and C Corky Miller from Louisville of the IL. Optioned RHP Joe Valentine to Louisville.

National Basketball Association DETROIT PISTONS--Re-signed G Richard Hamilton to a seven-year contract. Women's National Basketball Association WNBA--Fined Phoenix coach John Shumate $1,000 for verbally abusing officials after an Aug. 8 game, and Washington F Chamique Holdsclaw $250 for comments regarding officiating following an Aug. 9 game.

National Football League BUFFALO BILLS--Agreed to terms with RB Willis McGahee on a five-year contract. CINCINNATI BENGALS--Waived OL Noah Swartz. GREEN BAY PACKERS--Waived WR Kamau Peterson. INDIANAPOLIS COLTS--Signed RB Mike Green. Waived WR Carl Morris. MIAMI DOLPHINS--Waived WR Robert Baker. MINNESOTA VIKINGS--Waived WR Derrick Alexander. NEW YORK JETS--Waived PK Clay Rush and OT Bobby Brandt. TENNESSEE TITANS--Signed CB Steve Smith and LS Kenneth Amato. Named Marcus Robertson director of player development.

National Hockey League ANAHEIM MIGHTY DUCKS--Traded LW Travis Brigley to Colorado for future considerations. ATLANTA THRASHERS--Signed F Randy Robitaille and F Eric Healey. BOSTON BRUINS--Rejected the $2.51 million salary set by an arbitrator for D Bryan Berard, making him a free agent. Signed F Sandy McCarthy to a one-year contract. CAROLINA HURRICANES--Agreed to terms with D Danny Markov on a three-year contract. FLORIDA PANTHERS--Re-signed RW Ivan Novoseltsev and LW Ryan Jardine to one-year contracts. Signed G Travis Scott to a two-year contract and C Janis Sprukts and C Greg Jacina to minor league contracts. Named Clint Malarchuk goaltending coach. SAN JOSE SHARKS--Traded C Chad Wiseman to the New York Rangers for LW Nils Ekman. Signed D Jesse Fibiger and Robert Mulick to one-year contracts.

NCAA--Announced Northern Colorado forfeited three wins, to Western State, North Dakota and Minnesota State at Mankato, from the 2002 football season for using an ineligible player. COLLEGE OF NEW JERSEY--Announced it has forfeited its men's tennis and softball victories from spring 2003 after self-reporting to the NCAA a secondary violation in each sport. RAMAPO--Named John Nepolitan men's and women's cross country and track and field coach. SOUTH CAROLINA--Suspended C Rolando Howell from the men's basketball team indefinitely following his arrest on a criminal domestic violence charge. WESTERN NEW ENGLAND--Named Sarah Kelly field hockey coach. WILLIAM SMITH--Announced the addition of golf to varsity level, starting in the 2003-04 season.
